definition: to hold the attention of an audience/to serve as the finale to a show
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: The distribution of overpressure field and the biological effects of muzzle blast wave during gun firing were explored.
sentences.chinese: 初步探討了炮口衝擊波的超壓場分佈和生物效應。

sentences.english: The comprehensive controlling system for the temperature field and the air pressure of the grate bed of the grate is established.
sentences.chinese: 建立鏈篦機篦牀溫度場與氣壓場綜合控制系統。

sentences.english: Adele, who performed during the awards, arrived in a short black cocktail dress.
sentences.chinese: 在典禮中獻唱的阿黛爾則以一身黑色短裙禮服壓場。

sentences.english: Subsurface temperature?pressure field controls dynamics of gas reservoir forming.
sentences.chinese: 地下溫壓場控制了氣藏的成藏動力學。
